Package battleship

Class Ship

java.lang.Object
battleship.Ship
Direct Known Subclasses:
Battleship, Cruiser, Destroyer, EmptySea, Submarine
public abstract class Ship
extends java.lang.Object
The Ship class is comprised of objects generated for the player to interact with on the Gameboar All of the ships and the EmptySea are subclasses of Ship

  • Field Summary

    Fields 
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    private int bowColumn
    BowColumn is the y-axis location of the Ship instance's bow
    private int bowRow
    BowRow is the x-axis location of the Ship instance's bow
    private boolean[] hit
    Array of hits on a particular instance of a ship
    private boolean horizontal
    Determines if the ship is placed horizontally or verticially.
    private int length
    length is the number of locations the ship takes up.

    • okToPlaceShipAt

      public boolean okToPlaceShipAt​(int row, int column, boolean horizontal, Ocean ocean)
      Based on the given row, column, and orientation, returns true if it is okay to put a ship of this length with its bow in this location; false otherwise. The ship must not overlap another ship, or touch another ship (vertically, horizontally, or diagonally), and it must not ”stick out” beyond the array. Does not actually change either the ship or the Ocean -it just says if it is legal to do so.
      Returns:
      true if it can place a ship legally and false if it cannot

    • placeShipAt

      public void placeShipAt​(int row, int column, boolean horizontal, Ocean ocean)
      “Puts” the ship in the ocean. This involves giving values to the bowRow, bowColumn, and horizontal instance variables in the ship, and it also involves putting a reference to the ship in each of 1 or more locations (upto4) in the ships array in the Ocean object.

    • shootAt

      public boolean shootAt​(int row, int column)
      If a part of the ship occupies the given row and column, and the ship hasn’t been sunk, mark that part of the ship as “hit” (in the hit array, index 0 indicates the bow)
      Parameters:
      row - location to shoot at
      column - location to shoot at
      Returns:
      true if hit, false if not

    • isSunk

      public boolean isSunk()
      Checks to see if all parts of a ship are hit
      Returns:
      true if all parts have been hit, false otherwise

    • toString

      public java.lang.String toString()
      Overrides toString()
      Overrides:
      toString in class java.lang.Object
      Returns:
      s if ship is sunk, x if ship is hit

    • isEmpty

      private boolean isEmpty​(Ship ship)
      Checks to see if there is a ship in the given location
      Parameters:

      Returns:
      "empty" for the given ship if nothing is there

    • getLocationHit

      boolean getLocationHit​(int row, int column)
      Gets the precise location (row and column) of where the ship was hit. Used to print an X if it is hit or an S if it is hit and sunk with said hit
      Parameters:
      row -
      column -
      Returns:
      the precise location of where the ship was hit.
